judgment_metrics.rationale: Core strike quality indicator; directly reflects center contact
Energy transfer efficiency; especially critical for long clubs where speed loss is magnified
Adequate descent required for distance control; shallow descent indicates poor launch

diagnostic_metrics.rationale: Informational but not grade-driving; acceptable spin range is wider for long clubs; low spin may be intentional for some players
Used for gapping validation and trend monitoring; not grade-driving because distance control intent varies
Informational for trajectory assessment; not grade-driving because acceptable range is wide

excluded_metrics.rationale: Speed is outcome, not strike quality; can vary intentionally
Swing characteristic, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope
Directional control, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope
Swing characteristic, not strike quality; out of Phase 0 scope

c_definition: C-shot indicates poor contact quality: thin/fat strike (low smash), insufficient ball speed for distance, or shallow descent angle. These shots lack the solid contact required for consistent distance.
notes: Long irons/hybrids prioritize solid contact and distance. Spin is DOWNGRADED to diagnostic because acceptable spin range is wider and player-dependent. Only 3 judgment metrics (smash, ball speed, descent). This prevents over-penalizing shots with intentionally lower spin.
